get.description: Query all ticker symbols which are supported by Polygon.io. This API currently includes Stocks/Equities, Crypto, and Forex.

parameters.name: ticker
parameters.description:
Specify a ticker symbol.
Defaults to empty string which queries all tickers.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Specify the type of the tickers. Find the types that we support via our [Ticker Types API](https://polygon.io/docs/stocks/get_v3_reference_tickers_types).
Defaults to empty string which queries all types.

parameters.name: market
parameters.description: Filter by market type. By default all markets are included.

parameters.name: exchange
parameters.description:
Specify the primary exchange of the asset in the ISO code format. Find more information about the ISO codes [at the ISO org website](https://www.iso20022.org/market-identifier-codes).
Defaults to empty string which queries all exchanges.

parameters.name: cusip
parameters.description:
Specify the CUSIP code of the asset you want to search for. Find more information about CUSIP codes [at their website](https://www.cusip.com/identifiers.html#/CUSIP).
Defaults to empty string which queries all CUSIPs.

Note: Although you can query by CUSIP, due to legal reasons we do not return the CUSIP in the response.

parameters.name: cik
parameters.description:
Specify the CIK of the asset you want to search for. Find more information about CIK codes [at their website](https://www.sec.gov/edgar/searchedgar/cik.htm).
Defaults to empty string which queries all CIKs.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
Specify a point in time to retrieve tickers available on that date.
Defaults to the most recent available date.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search for terms within the ticker and/or company name.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: Specify if the tickers returned should be actively traded on the queried date. Default is true.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
The field to sort the results on. Default is ticker.
If the `search` query parameter is present, `sort` is ignored and results are ordered by relevance.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The order to sort the results on. Default is asc (ascending).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
Limit the size of the response, default is 100 and max is 1000.

If your query returns more than the max limit and you want to retrieve the next page of results,
see the `next_url` response attribute.

200.description: Reference Tickers.

results.description:
An array of tickers that match your query.

Note: Although you can query by CUSIP, due to legal reasons we do not return the CUSIP in the response.

ticker.description: The exchange symbol that this item is traded under.

name.description: The name of the asset. For stocks/equities this will be the companies registered name. For crypto/fx this will be the name of the currency or coin pair.

market.description: The market type of the asset.

primary_exchange.description: The ISO code of the primary listing exchange for this asset.

type.description: The type of the asset. Find the types that we support via our [Ticker Types API](https://polygon.io/docs/stocks/get_v3_reference_tickers_types).

active.description: Whether or not the asset is actively traded. False means the asset has been delisted.

currency_name.description: The name of the currency that this asset is traded with.

cik.description: The CIK number for this ticker. Find more information [here](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Central_Index_Key).

composite_figi.description: The composite OpenFIGI number for this ticker. Find more information [here](https://www.openfigi.com/assets/content/Open_Symbology_Fields-2a61f8aa4d.pdf)

share_class_figi.description: The share Class OpenFIGI number for this ticker. Find more information [here](https://www.openfigi.com/assets/content/Open_Symbology_Fields-2a61f8aa4d.pdf)

last_updated_utc.description: The information is accurate up to this time.

delisted_utc.description: The last date that the asset was traded.

next_url.description: If present, this value can be used to fetch the next page of data.

request_id.description: A request id assigned by the server.

status.description: The status of this request's response.

count.description: The total number of results for this request.

get.description: Get a single ticker supported by Polygon.io. This response will have detailed information about the ticker and the company behind it.

parameters.name: ticker
parameters.description: The ticker symbol of the asset.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
Specify a point in time to get information about the ticker available on that date.
When retrieving information from SEC filings, we compare this date with the period of report date on the SEC filing.

For example, consider an SEC filing submitted by AAPL on 2019-07-31, with a period of report date ending on 2019-06-29.
That means that the filing was submitted on 2019-07-31, but the filing was created based on information from 2019-06-29.
If you were to query for AAPL details on 2019-06-29, the ticker details would include information from the SEC filing.

Defaults to the most recent available date.

results.name: Apple Inc.
results.description: Apple designs a wide variety of consumer electronic devices, including smartphones (iPhone), tablets (iPad), PCs (Mac), smartwatches (Apple Watch), AirPods, and TV boxes (Apple TV), among others. The iPhone makes up the majority of Apple's total revenue. In addition, Apple offers its customers a variety of services such as Apple Music, iCloud, Apple Care, Apple TV+, Apple Arcade, Apple Card, and Apple Pay, among others. Apple's products run internally developed software and semiconductors, and the firm is well known for its integration of hardware, software and services. Apple's products are distributed online as well as through company-owned stores and third-party retailers. The company generates roughly 40% of its revenue from the Americas, with the remainder earned internationally.

results.title: Cathie Wood Adds More Coinbase, Skillz, Trims Square
results.author: Rachit Vats
results.description:
Cathie Wood-led Ark Investment Management on Friday snapped up another 221,167 shares of the cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase Global Inc (NASDAQ: COIN) worth about $64.49 million on the stock’s Friday’s dip and also its fourth-straight loss.

The investment firm’s Ark Innovation ETF (NYSE: ARKK) bought the shares of the company that closed 0.63% lower at $291.60 on Friday, giving the cryptocurrency exchange a market cap of $58.09 billion. Coinbase’s market cap has dropped from $85.8 billion on its blockbuster listing earlier this month.

The New York-based company also added another 3,873 shares of the mobile gaming company Skillz Inc (NYSE: SKLZ), just a day after snapping 1.2 million shares of the stock.

ARKK bought the shares of the company which closed ...

Full story available on Benzinga.com

get.description: Get trades for a given ticker symbol on a specified date.

parameters.name: ticker
parameters.description: The ticker symbol we want trades for.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The date/day of the trades to retrieve in the format YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: The timestamp offset, used for pagination. This is the offset at which to start the results. Using the `timestamp` of the last result as the offset will give you the next page of results.

parameters.name: timestampLimit
parameters.description: The maximum timestamp allowed in the results.

parameters.name: reverse
parameters.description: Reverse the order of the results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the size of the response, max 50000 and default 5000.

200.description: A list of trades.

ticker.description: The exchange symbol that this item is traded under.

results_count.description: The total number of results for this request.

db_latency.description: Latency in milliseconds for the query results from the database.

success.description: Whether or not this query was executed successfully.

T.description: The exchange symbol that this item is traded under.

t.description: The nanosecond accuracy SIP Unix Timestamp. This is the timestamp of when the SIP received this message from the exchange which produced it.

y.description: The nanosecond accuracy Participant/Exchange Unix Timestamp. This is the timestamp of when the quote was actually generated at the exchange.

f.description: The nanosecond accuracy TRF(Trade Reporting Facility) Unix Timestamp. This is the timestamp of when the trade reporting facility received this message.

q.description:
The sequence number represents the sequence in which message events happened.
These are increasing and unique per ticker symbol, but will not always be
sequential (e.g., 1, 2, 6, 9, 10, 11).

c.description: A list of condition codes.

items.description:
The condition code. These are the conditions of this message. See
[Condition Mappings](https://polygon.io/docs/get_v3_reference_conditions)
for a mapping to exchange conditions.

i.description:
The Trade ID which uniquely identifies a trade. These are unique per
combination of ticker, exchange, and TRF. For example: A trade for AAPL
executed on NYSE and a trade for AAPL executed on NASDAQ could potentially
have the same Trade ID.

p.description:
The price of the trade. This is the actual dollar value per whole share of
this trade. A trade of 100 shares with a price of $2.00 would be worth a
total dollar value of $200.00.

s.description: The size of a trade (also known as volume).

x.description: The exchange ID. See Exchanges for Polygon.io's mapping of exchange IDs.

r.description: The ID for the Trade Reporting Facility where the trade took place.

z.description:
There are 3 tapes which define which exchange the ticker is listed on. These are integers in our objects which represent the letter of the alphabet. Eg: 1 = A, 2 = B, 3 = C.
* Tape A is NYSE listed securities
* Tape B is NYSE ARCA / NYSE American
* Tape C is NASDAQ

For example, if timespan = minute and multiplier = 5 then 5-minute bars will be returned.

parameters.description: The end of the aggregate time window. Either a date with the format YYYY-MM-DD or a millisecond timestamp.

Whether or not the results are adjusted for splits.  By default, results are adjusted.
Set this to false to get results that are NOT adjusted for splits.

get.description:
Get the most up-to-date market data for all traded stock symbols.

Note: Snapshot data is cleared at 12am EST and gets populated as data is received from the exchanges. This can happen as early as 4am EST.

get.description:
Get the most up-to-date market data for the current top 20 gainers or losers of the day in the stocks/equities markets.

Top gainers are those tickers whose price has increased by the highest percentage since the previous day's close. Top losers are those tickers whose price has decreased by the highest percentage since the previous day's close.

Note: Snapshot data is cleared at 12am EST and gets populated as data is received from the exchanges.

get.description: Get the most recent trade for a given options contract.

parameters.name: optionsTicker
parameters.description: The ticker symbol of the options contract.

200.description: The last trade for this options contract.

status.description: The status of this request's response.

request_id.description: A request id assigned by the server.

T.description: The exchange symbol that this item is traded under.

t.description: The nanosecond accuracy SIP Unix Timestamp. This is the timestamp of when the SIP received this message from the exchange which produced it.

y.description: The nanosecond accuracy Participant/Exchange Unix Timestamp. This is the timestamp of when the quote was actually generated at the exchange.

f.description: The nanosecond accuracy TRF(Trade Reporting Facility) Unix Timestamp. This is the timestamp of when the trade reporting facility received this message.

q.description:
The sequence number represents the sequence in which message events happened.
These are increasing and unique per ticker symbol, but will not always be
sequential (e.g., 1, 2, 6, 9, 10, 11).

c.description: A list of condition codes.

items.description:
The condition code. These are the conditions of this message. See
[Condition Mappings](https://polygon.io/docs/get_v3_reference_conditions)
for a mapping to exchange conditions.

i.description:
The Trade ID which uniquely identifies a trade. These are unique per
combination of ticker, exchange, and TRF. For example: A trade for AAPL
executed on NYSE and a trade for AAPL executed on NASDAQ could potentially
have the same Trade ID.

p.description:
The price of the trade. This is the actual dollar value per whole share of
this trade. A trade of 100 shares with a price of $2.00 would be worth a
total dollar value of $200.00.

s.description: The size of a trade (also known as volume).

x.description: The exchange ID. See Exchanges for Polygon.io's mapping of exchange IDs.

r.description: The ID for the Trade Reporting Facility where the trade took place.

z.description:
There are 3 tapes which define which exchange the ticker is listed on. These are integers in our objects which represent the letter of the alphabet. Eg: 1 = A, 2 = B, 3 = C.
* Tape A is NYSE listed securities
* Tape B is NYSE ARCA / NYSE American
* Tape C is NASDAQ

get.description:
Get aggregate bars for an option contract over a given date range in custom time window sizes.

For example, if timespan = minute and multiplier = 5 then 5-minute bars will be returned.

parameters.name: optionsTicker
parameters.description: The ticker symbol of the options contract.

parameters.name: multiplier
parameters.description: The size of the timespan multiplier.

parameters.name: timespan
parameters.description: The size of the time window.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The start of the aggregate time window. Either a date with the format YYYY-MM-DD or a millisecond timestamp.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The end of the aggregate time window. Either a date with the format YYYY-MM-DD or a millisecond timestamp.

parameters.name: adjusted
parameters.description:
Whether or not the results are adjusted for splits.  By default, results are adjusted.
Set this to false to get results that are NOT adjusted for splits.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sort the results by timestamp.
`asc` will return results in ascending order (oldest at the top),
`desc` will return results in descending order (newest at the top).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limits the number of base aggregates queried to create the aggregate results. Max 50000 and Default 5000. Read more about how limit is used to calculate aggregate results in our article on Aggregate Data API Improvements.

adjusted.description: Whether or not this response was adjusted for splits.

queryCount.description: The number of aggregates (minute or day) used to generate the response.

resultsCount.description: The total number of results for this request.

request_id.description: A request id assigned by the server.

h.description: The highest price for the symbol in the given time period.

l.description: The lowest price for the symbol in the given time period.

c.description: The close price for the symbol in the given time period.

v.description: The trading volume of the symbol in the given time period.

t.description: The Unix Msec timestamp for the start of the aggregate window.

n.description: The number of transactions in the aggregate window.

parameters.description: The "from" symbol of the pair.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The "to" symbol of the pair.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The date of the requested open/close in the format YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.name: adjusted
parameters.description:
Whether or not the results are adjusted for splits.  By default, results are adjusted.
Set this to false to get results that are NOT adjusted for splits.

200.description: The open/close of this symbol.

symbol.description: The symbol pair that was evaluated from the request.

isUTC.description: Whether or not the timestamps are in UTC timezone.

day.description: The date requested.

open.description: The open price for the symbol in the given time period.

close.description: The close price for the symbol in the given time period.

p.description:
The price of the trade. This is the actual dollar value per whole share of
this trade. A trade of 100 shares with a price of $2.00 would be worth a
total dollar value of $200.00.

s.description: The size of a trade (also known as volume).

x.description: The exchange that this crypto trade happened on. See Exchanges for a mapping of exchanges to IDs.

c.description: A list of condition codes.

items.description:
The condition code. These are the conditions of this message. See
[Condition Mappings](https://polygon.io/docs/get_v3_reference_conditions)
for a mapping to exchange conditions.

t.description: The Unix Msec timestamp for the start of the aggregate window.

i.description:
The Trade ID which uniquely identifies a trade. These are unique per
combination of ticker, exchange, and TRF. For example: A trade for AAPL
executed on NYSE and a trade for AAPL executed on NASDAQ could potentially
have the same Trade ID.

x.description: The exchange that this crypto trade happened on. See Exchanges for a mapping of exchanges to IDs.

for a mapping to exchange conditions.

t.description: The Unix Msec timestamp for the start of the aggregate window.

get.description:
Get aggregate bars for a cryptocurrency pair over a given date range in custom time window sizes.

For example, if timespan = minute and multiplier = 5 then 5-minute bars will be returned.

parameters.name: cryptoTicker
parameters.description: The ticker symbol of the currency pair.

parameters.name: multiplier
parameters.description: The size of the timespan multiplier.

parameters.name: timespan
parameters.description: The size of the time window.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The start of the aggregate time window. Either a date with the format YYYY-MM-DD or a millisecond timestamp.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The end of the aggregate time window. Either a date with the format YYYY-MM-DD or a millisecond timestamp.

parameters.name: adjusted
parameters.description:
Whether or not the results are adjusted for splits.  By default, results are adjusted.
Set this to false to get results that are NOT adjusted for splits.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sort the results by timestamp.
`asc` will return results in ascending order (oldest at the top),
`desc` will return results in descending order (newest at the top).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limits the number of base aggregates queried to create the aggregate results. Max 50000 and Default 5000. Read more about how limit is used to calculate aggregate results in our article on Aggregate Data API Improvements.

get.description:
Get the current level 2 book of a single ticker. This is the combined book from all of the exchanges.

Note: Snapshot data is cleared at 12am EST and gets populated as data is received from the exchanges.

parameters.name: ticker
parameters.description: The cryptocurrency ticker.

200.description: Get current level 2 book for a ticker

allOf.description: The status of this request's response.

ticker.description: The exchange symbol that this item is traded under.

p.description: The price of this book level.

x.description:
A map of the exchange ID to number of shares at this price level.

**Example:**
`{ "p": 16302.94, "x": { "1": 0.02859424, "6": 0.023455 } }`

In this example, exchange ID 1 has 0.02859424 shares available at $16,302.94, and exchange ID 6 has 0.023455 shares at the same price level.

p.description: The price of this book level.

x.description:
A map of the exchange ID to number of shares at this price level.

**Example:**
`{ "p": 16302.94, "x": { "1": 0.02859424, "6": 0.023455 } }`

In this example, exchange ID 1 has 0.02859424 shares available at $16,302.94, and exchange ID 6 has 0.023455 shares at the same price level.

bidCount.description: The combined total number of bids in the book.

askCount.description: The combined total number of asks in the book.

spread.description: The difference between the best bid and the best ask price accross exchanges.

get.description:
Get the current top 20 gainers or losers of the day in cryptocurrency markets.

Top gainers are those tickers whose price has increased by the highest percentage since the previous day's close. Top losers are those tickers whose price has decreased by the highest percentage since the previous day's close.

Note: Snapshot data is cleared at 12am EST and gets populated as data is received from the exchanges.

p.description: The price of this book level.

x.description:
A map of the exchange ID to number of shares at this price level.

**Example:**
`{ "p": 16302.94, "x": { "1": 0.02859424, "6": 0.023455 } }`

In this example, exchange ID 1 has 0.02859424 shares available at $16,302.94, and exchange ID 6 has 0.023455 shares at the same price level.

bidCount.description: The combined total number of bids in the book.

askCount.description: The combined total number of asks in the book.

spread.description: The difference between the best bid and the best ask price accross exchanges.

results.description:
An array of tickers that match your query.

Note: Although you can query by CUSIP, due to legal reasons we do not return the CUSIP in the response.

ticker.description: The exchange symbol that this item is traded under.

name.description: The name of the asset. For stocks/equities this will be the companies registered name. For crypto/fx this will be the name of the currency or coin pair.

market.description: The market type of the asset.

primary_exchange.description: The ISO code of the primary listing exchange for this asset.

type.description: The type of the asset. Find the types that we support via our [Ticker Types API](https://polygon.io/docs/stocks/get_v3_reference_tickers_types).

active.description: Whether or not the asset is actively traded. False means the asset has been delisted.

currency_name.description: The name of the currency that this asset is traded with.

cik.description: The CIK number for this ticker. Find more information [here](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Central_Index_Key).

composite_figi.description: The composite OpenFIGI number for this ticker. Find more information [here](https://www.openfigi.com/assets/content/Open_Symbology_Fields-2a61f8aa4d.pdf)

share_class_figi.description: The share Class OpenFIGI number for this ticker. Find more information [here](https://www.openfigi.com/assets/content/Open_Symbology_Fields-2a61f8aa4d.pdf)

last_updated_utc.description: The information is accurate up to this time.

delisted_utc.description: The last date that the asset was traded.

active.description: Whether or not the asset is actively traded. False means the asset has been delisted.

share_class_shares_outstanding.description: The recorded number of outstanding shares for this particular share class.

weighted_shares_outstanding.description: The shares outstanding calculated assuming all shares of other share classes are converted to this share class.

market_cap.description: The most recent close price of the ticker multiplied by weighted outstanding shares.

phone_number.description: The phone number for the company behind this ticker.

address1.description: The first line of the company's headquarters address.

city.description: The city of the company's headquarters address.

state.description: The state of the company's headquarters address.

postal_code.description: The postal code of the company's headquarters address.

sic_code.description: The standard industrial classification code for this ticker. For a list of SIC Codes, see the SEC's SIC Code List.

sic_description.description: A description of this ticker's SIC code.

ticker_root.description: The root of a specified ticker. For example, the root of BRK.A is BRK.

ticker_suffix.description: The suffix of a specified ticker. For example, the suffix of BRK.A is A.

total_employees.description: The approximate number of employees for the company.

list_date.description: The date that the symbol was first publicly listed in the format YYYY-MM-DD.

homepage_url.description: The URL of the company's website homepage.

description.description: A description of the company and what they do/offer.

logo_url.description:
A link to this ticker's company's logo.
Note that you must provide an API key when accessing this URL. See the "Authentication" section at the top of this page for more details.

icon_url.description:
A link to this ticker's company's icon. Icon's are generally smaller, square images that represent the company at a glance.
Note that you must provide an API key when accessing this URL. See the "Authentication" section at the top of this page for more details.

sequential (e.g., 1, 2, 6, 9, 10, 11).

sequential (e.g., 1, 2, 6, 9, 10, 11).

s.description: The bid size. This represents the number of round lot orders at the given bid price. The normal round lot size is 100 shares. A bid size of 2 means there are 200 shares for purchase at the given bid price.

Bid Exchange Id

S.description: The ask size. This represents the number of round lot orders at the given ask price. The normal round lot size is 100 shares. An ask size of 2 means there are 200 shares available to purchase at the given ask price.

allOf.description: The exchange ID. See Exchanges for Polygon.io's mapping of exchange IDs.
Ask Exchange Id

z.description:
There are 3 tapes which define which exchange the ticker is listed on. These are integers in our objects which represent the letter of the alphabet. Eg: 1 = A, 2 = B, 3 = C.
* Tape A is NYSE listed securities
* Tape B is NYSE ARCA / NYSE American
* Tape C is NASDAQ

AggregateTimespan.description: The size of the time window.

AggregateTimeFrom.name: from
AggregateTimeFrom.description: The start of the aggregate time window. Either a date with the format YYYY-MM-DD or a millisecond timestamp.

AggregateTimeTo.name: to
AggregateTimeTo.description: The end of the aggregate time window. Either a date with the format YYYY-MM-DD or a millisecond timestamp.

AggregateAdjusted.name: adjusted
AggregateAdjusted.description:
Whether or not the results are adjusted for splits.  By default, results are adjusted.
Set this to false to get results that are NOT adjusted for splits.

AggregateSort.name: sort
AggregateSort.description:
Sort the results by timestamp.
`asc` will return results in ascending order (oldest at the top),
`desc` will return results in descending order (newest at the top).

AggregateDate.name: date
AggregateDate.description: The beginning date for the aggregate window.

ReverseOrder.name: reverse
ReverseOrder.description: Reverse the order of the results.

SnapshotDirection.name: direction
SnapshotDirection.description: The direction of the snapshot results to return.

LimitMax50000.name: limit
LimitMax50000.description: Limit the size of the response, max 50000 and default 5000.

AggregateLimitMax50000.name: limit
AggregateLimitMax50000.description: Limits the number of base aggregates queried to create the aggregate results. Max 50000 and Default 5000. Read more about how limit is used to calculate aggregate results in our article on Aggregate Data API Improvements.

LimitMax10000.name: limit
LimitMax10000.description: Limit the size of the response, max 10000.
